評.definition: to discuss; to comment; to criticize; to judge; to choose (by public appraisal)

評事.definition: to discuss and evaluate; to appraise

評估.definition: to evaluate; to assess; assessment; evaluation

評價量規.definition: rubric (i.e. a guide listing specific criteria for grading)

評分.definition: to grade; to mark (student's work); grade; score (of student's work)

評委.definition: evaluation committee; judging panel; judging panel member; adjudicator (abbr. for 評選委員會委員|评选委员会委员[ping2xuan3 wei3yuan2hui4 wei3yuan2])

評定.definition: to evaluate; to make one's judgment

評審.definition: to appraise; to evaluate; to judge

評審團特別獎.pinyin: píng shěn tuán tè bié jiǎng
評審團特別獎.definition: Special Jury Prize, award at the Venice Film Festival

評書.definition: pingshu, a folk art where a single performer narrates stories from history or fiction

評為.definition: to elect as; to choose as; to consider as

評獎.definition: to determine the recipient of an award through discussion

評理.definition: to judge between right and wrong; to reason things out

評話.definition: storytelling dramatic art dating back to Song and Yuan periods, single narrator without music, often historical topics with commentary

評論.definition: to comment on; to discuss; comment; commentary; CL:篇[pian1]

評選.definition: to select on the basis of a vote or consensus

評頭品足.definition: to make idle remarks about a woman's appearance (idiom)

評頭論足.definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance; fig. to find fault in minor details; to remark upon a person's appearance; nitpicking; overcritical; judgmental

評點.definition: to comment; a point by point commentary
